message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $10000. I'm willing to give you a 10-year warranty and a 100% satisfaction guarantee. I'm confident you'll love this product and it will exceed your expectations. Would you like to purchase it?
I'm not willing to pay $10000 for a product without knowing its quality. I'd like to see more information about the product or wait for the next round.

I understand your concerns, Bob. Let me offer you a compromise. I'll give you a chance to buy this high-quality product for $9000, which is a 10% discount from the original price. This is the lowest price I can offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal anywhere else. If you're still hesitant, I can also offer to let you inspect the product before purchasing, but I must warn you that this will void the warranty.

I'm not interested in buying a product that I don't know the quality of, even at a discounted price. I'd rather wait for the next round and see if I can get a better deal or more information about the product.
